conclusion: The semi-cylindrical transparent brick has a radius r and a refractive index n.
The laser beam starts at point A and moves towards point C at a uniform speed v along the diameter AC.
The laser beam is initially perpendicular to AC at point A.
The laser beam moves from A to C along the diameter AC at speed v.
The length of AC is 2r (since it is the diameter of the semi-cylinder).
The time t taken for the laser beam to travel from A to C is given by t = 2r/v.
The laser beam will emerge from the arc surface ABC when it reaches point C.
Since the laser beam moves uniformly from A to C, it will emerge from the arc surface exactly when it reaches point C.
The moment when the laser beam emerges from the arc surface ABC is when it has traveled the entire distance from A to C.
The laser beam emerges from the arc surface ABC at time t = 2r/v.
